segments.speaker: A
segments.text: With that flexibility he like whereas I was like hang on a second you mean we could put everything into this and we could do everything we could throw everything at the rest of the sun and it still could not work right that's farming so ultimately the passion project it has to be a passion project first of all you have to love it and for the first few years we said we were farming for the lifestyle because every dollar we made if we made a dollar went back into the farm so we were farming for a lifestyle but ultimately that lifestyle was something that gave us so much energy so much joy and it just felt right so if you had told me 10 years ago that I'd be living on a farm and I'd be a farmer's wife and attempting to you know be as good as my husband using the farming world I would have thought you were off your head whereas here we are and I couldn't be happier

segments.speaker: A
segments.text: there are so many things i love about your career trajectory but i think one of my favorite is the fact that you started off in the pool and ended up on a farm so inspiring the way you started with you be and i mean i take courage to keep pivoting and pivoting and pivoting from the women who are considering a career change a pivot a switch in whatever capacity in their career or their life what would you say to them don't let anything define you let you define you you can be so multifaceted you can have so many strings to your bow you can be everything or nothing if you don't want don't let a job or a career or a label define you define yourself and find a way to explore everything anything that you're interested in because that's my first tip my second tip is i really think the whole point of being human and being on this planet what we're all trying to achieve ultimately

segments.speaker: A
segments.text: we want to die one day happy and at peace with no regrets.

segments.speaker: A
segments.text: most people I speak to that would be the ultimate way to end up.

text:
With that flexibility he like whereas I was like hang on a second you mean we could put everything into this and we could do everything we could throw everything at the rest of the sun and it still could not work right that's farming so ultimately the passion project it has to be a passion project first of all you have to love it and for the first few years we said we were farming for the lifestyle because every dollar we made if we made a dollar went back into the farm so we were farming for a lifestyle but ultimately that lifestyle was something that gave us so much energy so much joy and it just felt right so if you had told me 10 years ago that I'd be living on a farm and I'd be a farmer's wife and attempting to you know be as good as my husband using the farming world I would have thought you were off your head whereas here we are and I couldn't be happier
there are so many things i love about your career trajectory but i think one of my favorite is the fact that you started off in the pool and ended up on a farm so inspiring the way you started with you be and i mean i take courage to keep pivoting and pivoting and pivoting from the women who are considering a career change a pivot a switch in whatever capacity in their career or their life what would you say to them don't let anything define you let you define you you can be so multifaceted you can have so many strings to your bow you can be everything or nothing if you don't want don't let a job or a career or a label define you define yourself and find a way to explore everything anything that you're interested in because that's my first tip my second tip is i really think the whole point of being human and being on this planet what we're all trying to achieve ultimately
Lee, he's happiness, we want to die one day happy and at peace with no regrets. That's my plan anyway, most people I speak to that would be the ultimate way to end up.
